item.title: Damaged wall, capstone knocked off. Roseneath Road, 3rd July
item.description:
This wall has been damaged, with the capstone knocked off, had been an issue for many months. My understanding is the council had said it is not their problem but cannot advise who the wall belongs to. Given the gardens in front of the wall (Roseneath side) are council managed I think it is fair presume this wall is their issue too, especially if they cannot provide alternative details of who actually owns the wall.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Roseneath Road, Balham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Israeki yellow ribbons tied to street railings, 3rd July
item.description:
Hundreds of Israeli yellow ribbons littering the streets of the local area. Offensive and an eyesore. This is becoming a nuisance and consistant problem in the borough and perpetrators need to be prosecuted
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Falloden Way, Hampstead Garden Suburb, London

item.title: On cycle path, 3rd July
item.description:
The loop to attach the bollard in place via a padlock is broken, so people are taking the bollard out and moving it or trying to hide and are driving along a pedestrian/cycle path as a result. The bollard ensures the area remains an environmentally protected area, however the is no longer the case as cars are no using the cycle path as a popular shortcut
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barker Drive, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet
